intro: Lundellianthus salvinii, commonly known as the Salvin's lundellia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
